summary: This is an email chain from August 2020 regarding a technical issue with a large, non-searchable draft report from the Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR). The report concerns OPR's investigation into the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida between 2006 and 2008. The emails discuss logistical challenges in sharing the document.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the OPR draft report, which investigates the handling of his case by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006-2008.

events.title: Handling of Epstein Matter by SD Florida
events.description: The period under review by the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) regarding how the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida handled the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: OPR Draft Report Transmitted
events.description: The Office of Professional Responsibility transmits its draft report and a cover letter to the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York regarding the Epstein matter handling review.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, 950 Pennsylvania Avenue, NAV â€” Room 3266, Washington, D.C. 20530
keyFacts: The Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) conducted a review of the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006 to 2008.
A draft report of this OPR investigation, exceeding 380 pages, was transmitted to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York in August 2020.
The document reveals internal logistical challenges (a large, non-searchable PDF) in distributing this sensitive OPR report within the Justice Department in 2020.
The correspondence confirms an ongoing, high-level internal review of prosecutorial conduct in the early Epstein case years after his 2019 arrest.
